Can also get over powered morph creatures into play cheap, like krosan colossus and krosan cloudscraper.

posts.post_content:
I play Red / Blue with Ixidors, Dream Chisles, Shirk alarmists, Demorplasms and a ton of really, really expensive morph creatures.
  
   
Shirk alarmist + Demorplasm = free Morpher every turn.
  
Dream Chisles makes everything faster.
  
Peity Charm + Erratic explosion leads to 7-10 damage for 3 with all the morphs around.
  
And then rush of knowledge will finish the game next turn. After drawing 6-10 cards you have enough dream chisles to lay every morph creature down for free.
posts.html:

And then rush of knowledge will finish the game next turn. After drawing 6-10 cards you have enough dream chisles to lay every morph creature down for free.

posts.post_content: the only problem with this guy is his reverse-synergy with [Ixidron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ixidron). he'll pump up all of your opponent's creatures. sure, you could cheat [krosan colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=krosan colossus) into play, but they can then triple-block him and kill him. I think though that at the end of the day you'll come out with card advantage.

posts.post_content:
@SwordOfKaldra : I feel you on that one, love the sotra-synergy...  
  
Here's the clarification: If you Venser a morphed creature, it will return Face-Up as all permanents enter place Face-up, Untapped, Unflipped, and Phased-In unless otherwise stated (like in morph rules), however this is not turning them Face-Up. however, This can be used to 'unmorph' Ixidor so HE can cause Morph effects to trigger.
posts.html:
@SwordOfKaldra : I feel you on that one, love the sotra-synergy...

Here's the clarification: If you Venser a morphed creature, it will return Face-Up as all permanents enter place Face-up, Untapped, Unflipped, and Phased-In unless otherwise stated (like in morph rules), however this is not turning them Face-Up. however, This can be used to 'unmorph' Ixidor so HE can cause Morph effects to trigger.
